  • View page source

django.core.management.color

Sets up the terminal color scheme.

Attributes

HAS_COLORAMA

Classes

Style

Functions

supports_color()

Return True if the running system's terminal supports color,

make_style([config_string])

Create a Style object from the given config_string.

no_style()

Return a Style object with no color scheme.

color_style([force_color])

Return a Style object from the Django color scheme.

Module Contents

django.core.management.color.HAS_COLORAMA = False[source]
django.core.management.color.supports_color()[source]

Return True if the running system’s terminal supports color, and False otherwise.

class django.core.management.color.Style[source]
django.core.management.color.make_style(config_string='')[source]

Create a Style object from the given config_string.

If config_string is empty django.utils.termcolors.DEFAULT_PALETTE is used.

django.core.management.color.no_style()[source]

Return a Style object with no color scheme.

django.core.management.color.color_style(force_color=False)[source]

Return a Style object from the Django color scheme.
